root_causes: AutoCheckOther behavior is not implemented: script contains only a commented placeholder rather than enforcing that an 'Other' code selection requires corresponding OE text.

DK handling is incomplete: CheckDK3D semantics likely require DK to be mutually exclusive (if DK selected no other options or OEs should be present), but the script treats A4DKx1=1 as automatically valid and skips other checks—this allows DK + other selections/OEs.

Special-code handling (e.g. 97/98/99/refuse/other codes) is not addressed. The script uses >0 to detect coded selections which may incorrectly count special codes as valid selections or fail to enforce exclusive semantics for those codes.
OE variable existence/naming is assumed (A4x1_1_other … A4x1_5_other) but not verified; if naming differs the OE checks will not run (logical gap).
instructions: Implement AutoCheckOther: add logic that if any sub-item equals the 'Other' answer code used in this survey (confirm which code(s) represent 'Other', e.g. 98 or 99), then the corresponding A4x1_#_other must be non-missing and non-empty. For example: if (A4x1_2 = 98 and (SYSMIS(A4x1_2_other) or RTRIM(LTRIM(A4x1_2_other))='')) A4x1_chk = 1.

Enforce DK exclusivity consistent with CheckDK3D('A4x1','A4DKx1'): when A4DKx1 = 1, flag an error if any sub-item is selected or any OE text exists. Example: if (A4DKx1 = 1 and ((A4x1_1>0) or (A4x1_2>0) or ... or RTRIM(LTRIM(A4x1_1_other))<>'' or ...)) A4x1_chk = 1.

Replace the broad 'any coded > 0' detection with explicit checks for the actual selection code(s) used for checkbox selections (usually =1). This prevents counting special codes (97/98/99) as valid selections. Example: compute any_coded = (A4x1_1 = 1 or A4x1_2 = 1 or ...).

Explicitly handle special codes: decide and implement how 97/98/99 (or other study-specific codes) should behave (e.g. treated as DK/Refuse/Other, mutually exclusive, or ignored for minimum-selection). Add conditions to treat these codes according to the study spec.

Verify OE variable names in the dataset and adapt code accordingly. If OE vars have different names (e.g. A4x1_1___other or A4x1_1_txt), update the script references so OE presence and length checks run against the actual variables.

Ensure open-text length check covers both: (a) OE presence required when 'Other' is selected and (b) the CheckOpenLengthMultiOE rule—i.e., if an OE exists it must meet the 5 non-space character minimum. If 'Other' is selected, both non-empty and minimum-length checks should apply.
